name: Aloft London Excel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aloft London Excel for one night, and although it was a little way out of the centre of London the hotel itself was beyond amazing!
reviews.title: Went above and beyond!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each room was a lavish as possible, with a huge television on the wall, lovely shower room that was huge! However, the bed was enormous and comfortable too! Beautiful
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: The 5 Stars go to the fact that I had organised a bottle of champagne for my boyfriend upon arrival, and they forgot! Well ... why the 5 stars then might you ask? Because when we got back from seeing our show there was a complimentary bottle of champagne in our room and a lovely handwritten note from the duty manager - this absolutely made our weekend!
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: Got room on a deal from one of the hotel finder websites for a great price. Came with "boxed" breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location for the o2 & excel arenas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is situated attached to the prince regent station on the docklands light railway. The hotel arrival was easy and they catered for an early check in at no extra charge.
reviews.title: Weekender away

reviews.text: Modern hotel, very well located right next to the Excel exhibitions center, with easy access to London City airport (473 bus, DLR or taxi). Young, efficient, enthusiastic staff. The room was good sized, very clean, with a nice view onto the Docklands. woluld certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Good hotel for exhibitions at Excel

reviews.text: Hotel is located right next to London Excel exam halls. Therefore ideal when doing an exam over there.
reviews.title: Perfect pre-exam stay for London Excel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to London City airport. Easily accessible via DLR.
reviews.title: Modern and stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has nice design.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Handy self check in unless you forget your pin code or are using Maestro (not accepted).
reviews.title: Great place for a cheap stay

reviews.text: Excellent hotel.spacious airy rooms, friendly staff. Free wifi. Highly recommended if you have to be in the area. Some of our party were scheduled to be off loaded to another hotel due to over-booking (hey, it happens). The helpful accommodating manager changed this arrangement immediately with good humour when I explained the circumstances.
reviews.title: Great for Excel

reviews.text: For the location, it’s a good Starwood property. I was on another assignment at the ExCel Convention Center and the hotel was in a prime location. The property is very clean and the staff are all amazing. The bar was off the hook!! The young bartender was the best I’ve seen thus far. He engages in conversation and well schooled in football! The only drawback to this hidden gem is the restaurant. The restaurant needs some serious help in expanding their menu. I had dinner once and that was enough for me. For the rest of the week I would eat out or visit a little pub that’s in walking distance. Not the best either, but by far better choice than the restaurant.
reviews.title: For the Location, It's a good Starwood Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A Lastminute booking on Bank Holiday Monday surprisingly meant a VERY cheap deal. The £200 rack rate is above my usual budgte. That said the hotel adjoins the Excel so the location was perfect. We arrived early and were allowed to check in at about 10.00 am. On site parking cheaper than others around.
reviews.title: Very convenient for Excel

reviews.text: It must be quite new and is high tech. The keycard only has to be waved in the lidt for security and the same again at the door. A spacious nicely decorated modern room. Large shower (no bath) and bathroom with tea/coffee facilities, hair dryer, big TV, lots of channels, free wifi, comfortable bed and, importantly, good lighting.
reviews.title: Fantastic place at the end of the track

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had one grouse it was that the tasty coffee bags, which unzipped and clipped to the rim of a cup, were too small for the large disposable paper cups of which there were only two, so dirty cups in the morning is you had coffee in the evening.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!!!!!
Brilliant hotle
reviews.text: Fantastic, modern, comfortable, relaxed and very welcoming. Brilliant friendly staff made our one night stay here very pleasurable. Room was very well appointed, lightning fast internet in the room and communal areas. Really felt like a home from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Modern

reviews.text: We spent one night at Aloft, choosing it because of it's close proximity to London City Airport.
reviews.title: The place where to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: The room was fabulous, big and clean. The bathroom was spotless.
reviews.title: Excellent

description: The only hotel directly connected to ExCel London International Convention Centre (ICC), Aloft London ExCel features 252 Guest Rooms and Suites, a w xyz(SM) bar, re:fuel by Aloft(SM) where guests can grab a snack 24/7, and the re:mix(SM) lounge. Complimentary wired and wireless high speed internet access is also available throughout the hotel.
